Have you looked at how eclipse handles AssertEquals of two Strings.

Not su=
re if this is a JUnit core functionality or not.  But eclipse highlights ho=
w the two strings differ.

Just wondering if you've ever seen this function=
ality... I'll send screen shots if not.

Big Mike

From: junit@yahoogroups.=
com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Sunburned Surveyor
Sent: Fr=
iday, November 20, 2009 12:06 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Cc: Martin Davis=
; Martin Davis
Subject: [junit] Gathering and displaying supplemental infor=
mation about test failures.



I have a question about the options for gath=
ering and displaying
supplemental information about test failures. Please a=
llow me to
illustrate my question with a simple example.

I've got a class =
called Coordinate that represents a point in a 3D
coordinate system. I've o=
verloaded the toString method of this class
to write out the X, Y, and Z va=
lues of the coordinate in a simple
String. Now I want to test my toString m=
ethod using JUnit.

If the Coordinate.toString test method fails (because t=
he string was
not constructed in the correct format) I would like to provid=
e the
programmer running the test with a copy of the incorrect string, sinc=
e
it provides valuable clues about what is broken with the method under
tes=
t. I typically do this by placing System.err.println statements in
my test =
method. However, I realize that using System.err.println isn't
the most por=
table or elegant way to provide this information to the
programmer executin=
g the test.

What I really want is a GUI that allows the programmer to sele=
ct a
failed test from a list of failed tests, and then to view supplemental=

test data I provide him/her.

I was thinking I could do this by completing=
 the following tasks:

- Implementing the RunListener interface in JUnit.
-=
 Create an extension of Exception that could contain a HashMap of
simple pa=
rameters and that would be passed to the constructor of a
Failure object fr=
om within a test.
- Creating Failure objects in my tests that contain the s=
upplemental
failrure data.
- Passing these failure objects to my RunListene=
r implementaiton.
- Creating a FailureProcessor class that displays a GUI w=
ith the
information in my RunListener implemenation to show the programmer
=
executing my tests the supplemental failure data as described above.
(Failu=
reProcessor would be an interface so that you could do different
things wit=
h the supplemental failure data, not just show it in a GUI.)

Before I begi=
n this work, I wanted to ask if there was a better way to
do this. I know I=
 could use a logging framework from within my test
method, but I really wan=
t to work within the JUnut framework, not
outside of it. I also want a nice=
 little GUI, not a log file.

How are other programmers handling instances =
when they want to display
supplemental data on failed tests? Does my approa=
ch sound reasonable?

The Sunburned Surveyor
